item.title: Google's Computers Are Making Thousands as Artists
item.description:
Google's Computers Are Making Thousands as Artists

If art is what makes us human, how come Google's bots can do it too? Google's artificial intelligence, or shall I say "painters," raked in thousands for charity over the weekend in San Francisco at an art show called " DeepDream: The art of neural networks. " The computers weren't working completely alone though.

item.title: Loving Vincent - Trailer 2016 (web)
item.description:
Loving Vincent - Trailer 2016 (web)

Trailer from the upcoming film "Loving Vincent" by Breakthru Films. Obtained from the official website: http://join.lovingvincent.com/ 12 oil paintings per second, all done by over 100 painters trained in the same style. I scaled this up from the original so I could upload it to YouTube while preserving the quality.

neural-style - Torch implementation of neural style algorithm

item.title: Pictures combined using Neural networks
item.description:
Pictures combined using Neural networks

This album is really big! It's going to take us a bit to get your download ready for you. Enter your email and we will notify you when it's ready. Once ready, it will be available for up to 24 hours.

item.title: Exploring the Intersection of Art and Machine Intelligence
item.description:
Exploring the Intersection of Art and Machine Intelligence

In June of last year, we published a story about a visualization techniques that helped to understand how neural networks carried out difficult visual classification tasks. In addition to helping us gain a deeper understanding of how NNs worked, these techniques also produced strange, wonderful and oddly compelling images.

item.title: Class visualization with bilateral filte...
item.description:
Class visualization with bilateral filte...

Class visualization with bilateral filtersHigh resolution neural network outputs from DeepDream by Mike Tyka illustrate clearer visuals of machine understanding of subjects:A while ago I played with style visualizations and bilateral filters. The latter have the nice property of filtering out noise but preserving edges. Here are some example class from GoogLeNet (Inception network).

item.title: Visual Turing Test
item.description:
Visual Turing Test

Figure out if paintings are made by a human or by a computer.

item.title: No title
Listen to Darwintunes: random music evolving its way to beauty
item.description:
Listen to Darwintunes: random music evolving its way to beauty

Darwintunes are short musical loops that mutate and evolve as listeners vote: "the higher rated loops get to have sex and have baby loops which form the next generation, to be rated, have sex, have babies and so on." The examples given start out as warbly bursts of random noise.
